climbs.name: Emancipation Proclamation
climbs.fa: H. Carter, T. Merrill, B. Sullivan

content.description: Tricky gear placements will take you up obvious, right-leaning crack into left-leaning seam.
content.protection: An anchor (guardrail), small cams to BD #2, and a set of stoppers.
content.location: Rap off guardrail near old anchor studs to the start of the climb. Once at bottom of the crag, this climb follows first right-leaning then left-leaning crack system.

content.description:
Climb the same start as

Emancipation Proclamation

. Head straight up past 3 "bolts". This is a technical slab that will literally keep you on your toes.

This is a very rewarding climb with delicate footwork and small crimps. Unless solid at the grade; it is a worthwhile toprope.

Gear is extremely limited, and only possible down low. The first bolt is missing its hanger (hex wire held in place over stud by nut). The crux is between second and last bolt where a fall would be dangerous.
content.location:
Rap down off the guardrail past 3 "bolts."

Anchor replaced spring 2021
